alert.note: Alert for St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 14 at 4:43AM AKST until December 16 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT AKST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 45 below occuring. Blizzard conditions expected starting this evening for St Lawrence Island, with winds gusting to 70 mph and 4 to 8 inches of snow. * WHERE...St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, 6 PM today to midnight Wednesday night. For the Wind Chill Advisory, now to 6 PM this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 70 mph will cause whiteout conditions in blowing snow starting this evening. Significant drifting of the snow is likely. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast
